pages.text: A few quality of life things that can be nice to get while you're in the first simulation.

Heights can be scary, so you might want to craft a couple of $(item)Slime Boots$() to keep you safe from any sort of falldamage.$(br2)Slime can easily be found in $(item)Lush Swamps$() in this simulation.
You can upgrade your $(l:portal_hub/6_hook)Hook$() to a much faster version.
This hang glider complements your $(l:portal_hub/6_hook)Hook$() really well and make you travel even faster.

pages.title: Tools
pages.text: You can get through the first simulation without any fancy $(item)Tools$(), but if you want to make them you can.
Read this book for more information about making$(br)$(item)Tools$().
Fill this thing up with $(item)Water$() and you are good to go.$(br2)Excellent for giving crops a gentle nudge in the right direction.

pages.title: Backpacks
pages.text: You can make equippable backpacks a bit into this simulation. Handy for storing $(item)Tools$() and $(item)Snacks$().$(br2)Toggle equip: $(item)$(k:vsb.kb.removeBackpack)$()$(br)Open keybind: $(item)$(k:vsb.kb.openBackpack)$()

A dank null is a thing of wonder. It will store items up to a threshold, and after reaching that threshold it will $(item)Void$() the items.$(br2)It will automatically collect drops that matches the current contents.
As you upgrade your dank null it can hold more item types, and every slot can hold more items.
